title: Regression in helpful compiler error message when working with lifetimes

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
So I have the following code:
```
struct Article {
    proof_reader: ProofReader,
}

struct ProofReader {
    name: String,
}

pub trait HaveRelationship<To> {
    fn get_relation(&self) -> To;
}

impl HaveRelationship<&ProofReader> for Article {
    fn get_relation(&self) -> &ProofReader {
        &self.proof_reader
    }
}
```
Which on the stable compiler gives this helpful error message:
```
error[E0495]: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime for lifetime parameter in generic type due to conflicting requirements
  --> src/main.rs:14:5
   |
14 |     fn get_relation(&self) -> &ProofReader {
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
note: first, the lifetime cannot outlive the anonymous lifetime #1 defined on the method body at 14:5...
  --> src/main.rs:14:5
   |
14 | /     fn get_relation(&self) -> &ProofReader {
15 | |         &self.proof_reader
16 | |     }
   | |_____^
note: ...but the lifetime must also be valid for the lifetime '_ as defined on the impl at 13:23...
  --> src/main.rs:13:23
   |
13 | impl HaveRelationship<&ProofReader> for Article {
   |                       ^
   = note: ...so that the method type is compatible with trait:
           expected fn(&Article) -> &ProofReader
              found fn(&Article) -> &ProofReader
```
Yet on the nightly compiler the compiler error does not inform me about lifetimes, but tells me the signature needs to be what it already is:
```
error: `impl` item signature doesn't match `trait` item signature
  --> src/main.rs:14:5
   |
10 |     fn get_relation(&self) -> To;
   |     ----------------------------- expected fn(&Article) -> &ProofReader
...
14 |     fn get_relation(&self) -> &ProofReader {
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ found fn(&Article) -> &ProofReader
   |
   = note: expected `fn(&Article) -> &ProofReader`
              found `fn(&Article) -> &ProofReader`
```
[playground stable version](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=313facbea2943615fb338e2ddff03e07)
[playground nightly version](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=f62a2c2bf90b45390e20be345141ea52)
